description: <span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-family: Helvetica; ">UMD 1.7.1 is the ninth release of UMD-1 (Unified Middleware&nbsp;</span><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-family: Helvetica; ">Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. &nbsp;</span><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-family: Helvetica; ">This release provides security updates from Technology Providers.</span>
releaseNotes: <span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-family: Helvetica; ">This release contains the following products:</span><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-family: Helvetica; "><br></span><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-family: Helvetica; ">Job management services:</span><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-family: Helvetica; "><br><ul><li>WMS 3.3.5-1: addressing a recently discovered security vulnerability<br></li></ul></span>
installationNotes: This is the ninth release of the UMD-1 that is made available for EGI's production infrastructure. Installation and configuration notes are available in the <a href="http://repository.egi.eu/category/umd_releases/distribution/umd_1/">EGI repository</a>
contact: For further information about the UMD, its goals and surrounding processes, and more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please send an Email to: cto (at) egi.eu.
technicalContact: For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release notes of this UMD release, or the related documentation provided by the Technology Providers, please visit the <a href="http://ggus.eu">EGI Helpdesk</a> to make a report.
knownIssues: Details containing known issues and workarounds found in EGI verification and staged rollout are collected in the <a href="https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-1:UMD-1.7.1">EGI Wiki</a>.
changeLog: This release introduces a security update for the WMS service.

products.name: emi.wms
products.description:
The Workload Management System (WMS) comprises a set of Grid middleware components responsible for the distribution and management

of tasks across Grid resources, in such a way that applications are conveniently, efficiently and effectively executed.



The specific kind of tasks that request computation are usually referred to as "jobs". In the WMS, the scope of tasks needs to be broadened to take into account other kinds of resources, such as storage or network capacity. This change of definition is mainly due to the move from batch-like activity to applications with more demanding requirements in areas like data access or interactivity, both with the user and with other tasks. The WMS will broaden its scope accordingly.
products.changeLog: This release is meant to address a vulnerability in the WMS, assessed by the SVG: SVG:Advisory-SVG-2012-4039.
